title: Miley Cyrus's Tattoos Are a Collection of Meaningful Moments
description: Miley Cyrus has a massive tattoo collection that seems to grow as the days go by. The singer got her first piece of ink in 2009 at the age of 17, and she hasn't stopped since. Now, after her three Grammy wins - in which she performed her hit song "Flowers" and displayed many of her patchwork designs - fans both old and new are curious about her collection. A quick search into her body art will reveal that, unlike many other celebrities who have their go-to tattooists, Cyrus's tattoos are the work of various artists - but several have some very special meanings behind them. Most recently in June 2025, Cyrus got the word "Muse" from an artist at Bang Bang Tattoo in New York City. Before that, in March of 2020 she got a design inspired by "Dance Me to the End of Love," a book that visualizes Leonard Cohen's song of the same name with illustrations by Matisse. The video shows the silhouette of a body that is etched onto her upper right arm, and it looks like one of Matisse's signature works inspired by his affinity for cutouts. Around that same time, she got a handwritten note that she received from Yoko Ono traced onto her shoulder (it read: "I'm proud of you, Yoko") and a cursive-script piece over her knuckles that read "Freedom," both in December 2019. There's plenty more where that came from, too. Read ahead for a brief guide to some of Cyrus's most meaningful tattoos.
author: Danielle Jackson
excerpt: Miley Cyrus has a lot of tattoos, and several of them have pretty special meanings behind them. See photos of Miley Cyrus's tattoos here.
text: Miley Cyrus has a massive tattoo collection that seems to grow as the days go by. The singer got her first piece of ink in 2009 at the age of 17, and she hasn't stopped since. Now, after her three Grammy wins — in which she performed her hit song "Flowers" and displayed many of her patchwork designs — fans both old and new are curious about her collection. A quick search into her body art will reveal that, unlike many other celebrities who have their go-to tattooists, Cyrus's tattoos are the work of various artists — but several have some very special meanings behind them. Most recently in June 2025, Cyrus got the word "Muse" from an artist at Bang Bang Tattoo in New York City. Before that, in March of 2020 she got a design inspired by "Dance Me to the End of Love," a book that visualizes Leonard Cohen's song of the same name with illustrations by Matisse. The video shows the silhouette of a body that is etched onto her upper right arm, and it looks like one of Matisse's signature works inspired by his affinity for cutouts. Around that same time, she got a handwritten note that she received from Yoko Ono traced onto her shoulder (it read: "I'm proud of you, Yoko") and a cursive-script piece over her knuckles that read "Freedom," both in December 2019. There's plenty more where that came from, too. Read ahead for a brief guide to some of Cyrus's most meaningful tattoos.Miley Cyrus's "Muse" TattooIn June 2025, Cyrus paid a visit to Bang Bang Tattoo in New York City for some fresh ink from artist Michelle Santana. The new tattoo on the back of the singer's shoulder reads "muse." Getty | Kevin MazurMiley Cyrus's Finger TattoosCyrus has a series of finger tattoos on her hands. On the right side, she has a small Sagittarius symbol for her zodiac sign, a pot leaf, a flower, a heart, an eye, two triangles, and three horizontal lines. Getty | John ShearerMiley Cyrus's Right Inner Arm TattoosOn the inside of Cyrus's right arm are a bunch of tattoos. A few of the designs include a tooth, a medium-sized coin design, and a series of script tattoos. Miley Cyrus's Motorcycle TattooThe motorcycle tattoo on Cyrus's upper arm near the shoulder is a replica of her dad Billy Ray Cyrus's bike. Getty | Matt WinkelmeyerMiley Cyrus's Left Outer Arm TattoosCyrus's left arm has a handful of unique, medium-sized designs. One of the inks is a small, intricate skeleton. There's also a four-line quote tattoo in a delicate cursive font. Right above her elbow, she also has a pin-up-style cowgirl.Getty | Emma McIntyreMiley Cyrus's Tiny Arm TattoosCyrus is a lover of small, patchwork-style designs. She has two hours that form a cross, an avocado, a heart, a flower, and a cartoon cat design. Some of her shorter script tattoos include "love never dies," "moo," "cattitude," "mama tried," "idolize yourself," "biewty," "cold blooded," "okie," and "beetle." Miley Cyrus's Henry Matisse Tattoo and Rock 'n' Roll HeartIn 2020, Cyrus got a cutout tattoo inspired by "Dance Me to the End of Love," a book that visualizes Leonard Cohen's song of the same name with illustrations by artist Henry Matisse. In 2019, the singer also got a rock 'n' roll heart with her then-boyfriend Cody Simpson. That ink features a heart with a knife going through it. Miley Cyrus's Freedom TattooIn 2019, Cyrus got a tattoo of the word "Freedom" in cursive on her right hand. Some of Cyrus's fans have speculated that the tattoo was in response to the end of her marriage to Liam Hemsworth, however she also has the lyric "Don't f*ck with my freedom" throughout her song "Mother's Daughter."Miley Cyrus's Symbol TattooIn October 2019, Cyrus got a string of ancient symbols on her forearm from tattooist Dr. Woo. The caption reads, "Ancient symbols found on rock walls with some woo twist." Below that design is the word "be."Miley Cyrus's "I'm Proud of You" TattooIn December 2019, Cyrus got a tattoo on her left shoulder that reads, "I'm proud of you, Yoko." According to the caption accompanying the photo her tattoo artist, Daniel Winter, posted of it on Instagram, the tattoo is actually a copy of a handwritten note that Yoko Ono once wrote Cyrus.Miley Cyrus's "92" TattooDays after getting her rose tattoo, the singer added another piece to her collection. She got the number "'92" etched on the back of her neck as a nod to her birth year, 1992.Miley Cyrus's Rose TattooShortly after her divorce from Liam Hemsworth, Cyrus debuted a rose tattoo on the back of her left arm via Instagram. She shared a black-and-white video of the rose with the caption, "When asked if what you say and do is done with purest intentions and only LOVE inside the heart?" Cyrus later shared a second video with the caption, "Every. Rose. Has. Its. Thorn."Getty | Frazer HarrisonMiley Cyrus's Left Side TattoosCyrus's first tattoo ever was the phrase "just breathe" on her rib cage in December 2009, which was reportedly done as a tribute to her close friend Vanessa, who died of cystic fibrosis, and both of her grandfathers, who died of lung cancer. The "just breathe" tattoo is joined by a moving image dedicated to her late dog, Floyd, who passed away in April 2014, and a naked woman standing in a body of water.Getty | J. MerrittMiley Cyrus's Mary Jane TattooOn her right forearm sits a portrait of Cyrus's pit bull, Mary Jane. Above that is the phrase, "love yer brain" and a heart that's made up of the word "Elvis" for the famous singer. Below that closer to her wrist is an anchor tattoo that she got done in Brazil in May 2011 by the artist Fabio Satori.Miley Cyrus's Emu Tattoo & Other DesignsAfter writing a song about her blowfish, Pablow, following its death in 2015, she went to famed celebrity tattoo artist Dr. Woo to get a piece of ink in its memory. Right above her Pablow tattoo sits a portrait of her beloved Shetland sheepdog, Emu, whom she adopted two months after the unexpected passing of her Alaskan klee kai, Floyd. Around that same area is a crescent moon and the Happy Hippie Foundation logo, her nonprofit organization. Getty | Steve GranitzMiley Cyrus's Teddy Roosevelt Quote TattooBack in 2012, Cyrus and her then-boyfriend, Liam Hemsworth, got coordinating tattoos on their left arms of quotes from Theodore Roosevelt. The singer had hers done in July of that year and chose an excerpt from the former president's legendary "Citizenship in a Republic" speech: "So that his place shall never be with those cold and timid souls who knew neither victory nor defeat." A few months later, Hemsworth picked a line from the same speech that reads, "If he fails, at least fails while daring greatly," which many assume is missing a "he." Oops.Getty | James DevaneyMiley Cyrus's Dream-Catcher TattooIn February 2011 at the age of 18, the singer got the image of a dream catcher tattooed on the right side of her torso, which represents her four brothers and sisters.Getty | VenturelliMiley Cyrus's Tattoo of Her GrandmotherIn addition to an animal tooth, Roman numerals, an anatomically correct heart, and the words "I'm in your corner" with Johnny Cash's signature, Cyrus's right arm is home to a portrait of her grandmother. She also has a horn tattoo on her upper inner arm. Getty | Angela WeissMiley Cyrus's Heart TattooCyrus's right hand has nine tiny tattoos total. That includes the heart on her pinky finger, which is a matching tattoo that she got with her mom, Tish Cyrus.Getty | Jon KopaloffMiley Cyrus's "LOVE" TattooThe singer has a tattoo of the word "LOVE" on the inside of her right ear, which she got in 2010. Getty | C FlaniganMiley Cyrus's Smiley-Face Ankle TattooIn 2014, Cyrus and her best friend, Cheyne Thomas, gave each other matching smiley-face tattoos. With more than nine years of industry experience, she has interviewed countless celebrities, reported on hundreds of beauty trends, and swatched more lipsticks than she can count. Prior to PS, Jessica worked for publications such as Makeup.com, Skincare.com, and The Zoe Report.
html:
Miley Cyrus has a massive tattoo collection that seems to grow as the days go by. The singer got her first piece of ink in 2009 at the age of 17, and she hasn't stopped since. Now, after her three Grammy wins — in which she performed her hit song "Flowers" and displayed many of her patchwork designs — fans both old and new are curious about her collection.

A quick search into her body art will reveal that, unlike many other celebrities who have their go-to tattooists, Cyrus's tattoos are the work of various artists — but several have some very special meanings behind them. Most recently in June 2025, Cyrus got the word "Muse" from an artist at Bang Bang Tattoo in New York City. Before that, in March of 2020 she got a design inspired by "Dance Me to the End of Love," a book that visualizes Leonard Cohen's song of the same name with illustrations by Matisse. The video shows the silhouette of a body that is etched onto her upper right arm, and it looks like one of Matisse's signature works inspired by his affinity for cutouts. Around that same time, she got a handwritten note that she received from Yoko Ono traced onto her shoulder (it read: "I'm proud of you, Yoko") and a cursive-script piece over her knuckles that read "Freedom," both in December 2019.

There's plenty more where that came from, too. Read ahead for a brief guide to some of Cyrus's most meaningful tattoos.

Miley Cyrus's "Muse" Tattoo

In June 2025, Cyrus paid a visit to Bang Bang Tattoo in New York City for some fresh ink from artist Michelle Santana. The new tattoo on the back of the singer's shoulder reads "muse."

Miley Cyrus's Finger Tattoos

Cyrus has a series of finger tattoos on her hands. On the right side, she has a small Sagittarius symbol for her zodiac sign, a pot leaf, a flower, a heart, an eye, two triangles, and three horizontal lines.

Miley Cyrus's Right Inner Arm Tattoos

On the inside of Cyrus's right arm are a bunch of tattoos. A few of the designs include a tooth, a medium-sized coin design, and a series of script tattoos.

Miley Cyrus's Motorcycle Tattoo

The motorcycle tattoo on Cyrus's upper arm near the shoulder is a replica of her dad Billy Ray Cyrus's bike.

Miley Cyrus's Left Outer Arm Tattoos

Cyrus's left arm has a handful of unique, medium-sized designs. One of the inks is a small, intricate skeleton. There's also a four-line quote tattoo in a delicate cursive font.

Right above her elbow, she also has a pin-up-style cowgirl.

Miley Cyrus's Tiny Arm Tattoos

Cyrus is a lover of small, patchwork-style designs. She has two hours that form a cross, an avocado, a heart, a flower, and a cartoon cat design. Some of her shorter script tattoos include "love never dies," "moo," "cattitude," "mama tried," "idolize yourself," "biewty," "cold blooded," "okie," and "beetle."

Miley Cyrus's Henry Matisse Tattoo and Rock 'n' Roll Heart

In 2020, Cyrus got a cutout tattoo inspired by "Dance Me to the End of Love," a book that visualizes Leonard Cohen's song of the same name with illustrations by artist Henry Matisse.

In 2019, the singer also got a rock 'n' roll heart with her then-boyfriend Cody Simpson. That ink features a heart with a knife going through it.

Miley Cyrus's Freedom Tattoo

In 2019, Cyrus got a tattoo of the word "Freedom" in cursive on her right hand. Some of Cyrus's fans have speculated that the tattoo was in response to the end of her marriage to Liam Hemsworth, however she also has the lyric "Don't f*ck with my freedom" throughout her song "Mother's Daughter."

Miley Cyrus's Symbol Tattoo

In October 2019, Cyrus got a string of ancient symbols on her forearm from tattooist Dr. Woo. The caption reads, "Ancient symbols found on rock walls with some woo twist."

Below that design is the word "be."

Miley Cyrus's "I'm Proud of You" Tattoo

In December 2019, Cyrus got a tattoo on her left shoulder that reads, "I'm proud of you, Yoko." According to the caption accompanying the photo her tattoo artist, Daniel Winter, posted of it on Instagram, the tattoo is actually a copy of a handwritten note that Yoko Ono once wrote Cyrus.

Miley Cyrus's "92" Tattoo

Days after getting her rose tattoo, the singer added another piece to her collection. She got the number "'92" etched on the back of her neck as a nod to her birth year, 1992.

Miley Cyrus's Rose Tattoo

Shortly after her divorce from Liam Hemsworth, Cyrus debuted a rose tattoo on the back of her left arm via Instagram. She shared a black-and-white video of the rose with the caption, "When asked if what you say and do is done with purest intentions and only LOVE inside the heart?"

Cyrus later shared a second video with the caption, "Every. Rose. Has. Its. Thorn."

Miley Cyrus's Left Side Tattoos

Cyrus's first tattoo ever was the phrase "just breathe" on her rib cage in December 2009, which was reportedly done as a tribute to her close friend Vanessa, who died of cystic fibrosis, and both of her grandfathers, who died of lung cancer.

The "just breathe" tattoo is joined by a moving image dedicated to her late dog, Floyd, who passed away in April 2014, and a naked woman standing in a body of water.

Miley Cyrus's Mary Jane Tattoo

On her right forearm sits a portrait of Cyrus's pit bull, Mary Jane. Above that is the phrase, "love yer brain" and a heart that's made up of the word "Elvis" for the famous singer.

Below that closer to her wrist is an anchor tattoo that she got done in Brazil in May 2011 by the artist Fabio Satori.

Miley Cyrus's Emu Tattoo & Other Designs

After writing a song about her blowfish, Pablow, following its death in 2015, she went to famed celebrity tattoo artist Dr. Woo to get a piece of ink in its memory.

Right above her Pablow tattoo sits a portrait of her beloved Shetland sheepdog, Emu, whom she adopted two months after the unexpected passing of her Alaskan klee kai, Floyd.

Around that same area is a crescent moon and the Happy Hippie Foundation logo, her nonprofit organization.

Miley Cyrus's Teddy Roosevelt Quote Tattoo

Back in 2012, Cyrus and her then-boyfriend, Liam Hemsworth, got coordinating tattoos on their left arms of quotes from Theodore Roosevelt.

The singer had hers done in July of that year and chose an excerpt from the former president's legendary "Citizenship in a Republic" speech: "So that his place shall never be with those cold and timid souls who knew neither victory nor defeat."

A few months later, Hemsworth picked a line from the same speech that reads, "If he fails, at least fails while daring greatly," which many assume is missing a "he." Oops.

Miley Cyrus's Dream-Catcher Tattoo

In February 2011 at the age of 18, the singer got the image of a dream catcher tattooed on the right side of her torso, which represents her four brothers and sisters.

Miley Cyrus's Tattoo of Her Grandmother

In addition to an animal tooth, Roman numerals, an anatomically correct heart, and the words "I'm in your corner" with Johnny Cash's signature, Cyrus's right arm is home to a portrait of her grandmother.

She also has a horn tattoo on her upper inner arm.

Miley Cyrus's Heart Tattoo

Cyrus's right hand has nine tiny tattoos total. That includes the heart on her pinky finger, which is a matching tattoo that she got with her mom, Tish Cyrus.

Miley Cyrus's "LOVE" Tattoo

The singer has a tattoo of the word "LOVE" on the inside of her right ear, which she got in 2010.

Miley Cyrus's Smiley-Face Ankle Tattoo

In 2014, Cyrus and her best friend, Cheyne Thomas, gave each other matching smiley-face tattoos.

Danielle Jackson was a former assistant editor for PS Beauty.

Jessica Harrington (she/her) is the senior editor of PS Beauty, where she oversees coverage around makeup, skin care, hair, tattoos, and more. With more than nine years of industry experience, she has interviewed countless celebrities, reported on hundreds of beauty trends, and swatched more lipsticks than she can count. Prior to PS, Jessica worked for publications such as Makeup.com, Skincare.com, and The Zoe Report.
